Hi!

Heritrix is a very new stuff for me but seems to be one of the best open 
source crawlers. I'd like to crawl a top level domain for only texts 
(html, plain, pdf, ps) but I couldn't composed the right order.xml.

I think I need set broad scope and add some exclude filter at least a 
regexp filter that ensures the right tld:

http://.*\.hu(:\d+)?/.*

(I tried that but .com pages were fetched)

How can I set that only text files should be fetched?

There is an other open source java crawler, 
called capek could replace part of an url before checking whether it is valid. (see http://www.egothor.org/twiki/bin/view/Know/RulesFile)

Can I implement this in heritrix? For example I'd like to skip session ids.

This is a simple rule file to gather pages:
replace         &                   &
replace         &\w+=[0-9a-fA-F]{8,}&   &
replace         &\w+=[0-9a-fA-F]{8,}\z  <EMPTY>
replace         \?\w+=[0-9a-fA-F]{8,}(&|\z)     \?
replace         ;\w+=[0-9a-fA-F]{8,}\?  \?
replace         &&                      <EMPTY>
replace         \?&                     \?
replace         \?$                     <EMPTY>


peter
